intro: Basanacantha hispida, commonly known as the rough-stemmed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its branched, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and have a succulent texture, aiding in water retention. Basanacantha hispida is often found in disturbed habitats and can serve as a food source for certain desert animals.
